history.content:
You could try taking DS100.

-----------------------------------

Try looking for Grad Courses after 126, 127, and 189. Deep RL, computer vision, NLP are all grad level courses worth signing up for to further interest in area of ML.

I heard from my friends in CogSci major who took both CogSci131 and CS188 saying that 131 is a slightly easier version of CS188. So you might just take CS188 as a EECS major.

You could try taking DS100.

-----------------------------------

Try looking for Grad Courses after 126, 127, and 189. Deep RL, computer vision, NLP are all grad level courses worth signing up for to further interest in area of ML.

children.subject: Haven't taken the course, but info 154 (data mining) seems to be interesting ML application.

I don't know which are offered next semester, but here's a general list:

EE C106: Intro to Robotics [dynamics, control, sensing]
Math 110: Linear Algebra [but the real gold is in Math 221]
CS 194-??: Computational Photography; Alyosha Efros

Some selected grad classes:

CS C280: Computer Vision
CS C267: Scientific Computing [parallelization, practical matrix algebra, some graph partitioning]
Math 221: Matrix Computations [how to compute SVDs + eigenvectors, etc.]

EE 227A/BT/C: Numerical optimization [It's hard to overemphasize the importance of numerical optimization to machine learning, as well as other fields of CS like graphics and theory.]

history.content:
I'm an EECS major who's currently taking EE126, EE127 and CS170. I was looking for classes to take next semester. 

I looked at https://bair.berkeley.edu/courses.html to get an idea of courses that could further my interests in ML.

Apart from CS189 and CS182, are there any other undergrad courses I should take? 

Is a course like CogSci 131: Computational Models of Cognition a good fit for someone who wants to explore more than just the mathematical aspect?
history.subject: Courses to further interest in ML
